Reviews.Title: “Nice location but sleep only”
Reviews.Author: fredex2
Reviews.Content: This flat hotel is 2 star category. Good things: - Location is perfect; - The rooms are located away from the street, no noise; - Near the hotel there are really good restaurants and Ice cream :D; - Big space in the room, nice for groups; - Cheap internet; Bad things: - The cleaning was terrible in the room and in the bathroom; - If you arrive any time out of the open time of the reception, you need to pay 15 euros (Sunday closed); - The basic soap in the bathroom does not exist...; General Comments: If you want air conditioning or the kitchen, you need to pay extra (Cheap). The Italy tax must be paid with cash only. It's a nice place to stay if it's clean.

Reviews.Title: “good value for one night--some hidden extras”
Reviews.Author: mominparisof3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this apartment hotel for one night to catch an early flight home the next day. For a family of five the price was just right. Please be aware that this hotel charges extra for use of the kitchen and air conditioning. We paid 10 euros for the air conditioning. This is a nightly rate. Overall, the place was clean, the location very close to the Vatican but a little out of the way to other popular spots. Good for one night or if you are not fussy about location.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Vatican, but is NOT a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kbuck18
Reviews.Content: This is a 1 1/2 star hotel (by U.S. standards). It is an apartment and has not been updated since the 70's and the walls are made of paper and we could not sleep because of the noise. There were locks on the cabinets, like someone was going to really steal the dishes. The bathroom was horrible, we wore shower shoes because it just had that gross feeling. We are not picky travelers, but this was really bad. There is not even a bar of soap provided. Also, the towels are more like rough, thick sheets, they are not normal towels. The two good things, 1) The guy running the place was nice and helpful. 2) It is less than 2blks to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “It's an actual apartment. Kinda cute”
Reviews.Author: nikistevens
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay here. We came from the south of France which was no were near as big, and friendly. The staff were amazing, they spoke english, very professional even knew who we were when we walked in. They give great advice too. We were surprised when we walked in that it's a small apartment. Bathroom was very small however. If your a big guy and you have the single suite, good luck with fitting in the shower. People complained on tripadvisor about the towels, they are very thin. But HUGE! and white as clean can be. Stop crying you babies. Your in a little gated apt. Community with local italians, so bring earplugs because they get up early, and it's kinda loud. But you can't hear the street. Which was great. Water tank is small, but has a gage on it, so you'll know how much you have. Bring your own soap.!! Restaurants 5 mins away are not touristy, but you little have to walk at least 5 mins towards the Vatican and up a small hill. Good restaurants and Gelato places. Not as expensive as we thought. Well, compared to Paris. It may be a little hard to find from the subway but we found a american who lived right by the hotel, and it's walking distance from the train. And the Vatican/ Great location. You don't even need the trains to get around Rome, just take the very cheap 1 euro busses. Wifi is only 2 euros a day, and I tried to find wifi around the area. Very hard to find one and not reliable. Just pay for theirs it works great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AMLAP
Reviews.Content: The apartment building is located near (5 min walk) the Vatican. The room was ok, quiet but nothing special at that rate (considering Rome is expensive). We stayed four nights, and they provide one paper thin bath towel per person. No change of sheets, one skinny dishwashing cloth. No soap, no salt/pepper, and 2 rolls of toilet (sand) paper. The kitchen accomodation was very basic. There was no A/C or heating while we where there. Note that the staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for the money”
Reviews.Author: LakesideQueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2 bedroom apartment which we felt was a very good price compared to anything else comparable. We did not want to spend too much as we knew we would be sightseeing all day. The apartment itself was set within an inner courtyard area, behind a large wooden door that lead out on to the road. It was just what we wanted clean and very spacious. Our room looked out on to roof tops. We liked the location, it was excellent, and very close to the underpass leading to St Peters Square. (2 mins walk) We actually walked to most of the sights from the apartment, with the exception of the Rome Forum. We also took the Tour Bus to get round and hopped on and off. /the ticket price was 15 Euros for 24hrs. the nearest stop was St Peters Square. To sum up, don't think you can go wrong with this place, we all liked it. and found it a perfectly acceptable place to stay and the area seemed nice/safe. Tips: Take a few basics with you, teabags, coffee sugar etc. Maybe even a towel?-The towels were acceptable, but just a bit like table cloths!!

Reviews.Title: “Hell is near The Vatican..”
Reviews.Author: Worldtime
Reviews.Content: Photos and webpage look very nice but it is really part of a low middle-class complex of apartments -you cannot see this until you arrive- It is smelly and noisy. There is no service at all from the staff who barely speaks English. Phone did not work during all the stay, A/C worked one day and the other.We took a large aparment and space is very limited, the kitchen is really a simple kitchenette with a few forks and spoons. Beds are cheap and very uncomfortable. Most importantly people are not friendly, and have no idea of customer service. Many priests and nuns stay there. I assume is part of their vows or penitence...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Javi909
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was just superb for the price! Big rooms, including kitchen and appliances, great location just 2 minutes away from Saint Peter's Basilica, and amenities like supermarket, transport, etc. Not far from the Hotel there are lots of trendy restaurants and shops. The only complaint would be the towels, there are so thin as sheets! that you can't get dry at all, so maybe bring your own. Apart from that everything was just perfect. I would recommend this Hotel 100%, for families, and couple travelers as well. Excellent value for money, a real bargain!

HotelInfo.Name: San Pietro La Corte
HotelInfo.Address: Via delle Fornaci 38, 00165 Rome, Italy
